loginWindow.message:
Chatruletka (ome.tv) Extension:

Chatruletka is the same thing as ome.tv and Minichat.
It's the largest free video chat empire in the world.
The 'videochat platform' includes three large mobile apps and over 40 websites (full list with proof).
It doesn't matter which site/application you connect to the system from, the userbase is shared between all of them.
This extension works only on videochatru.com and ome.tv

extension_description.message: Extension for Chatruletka (aka ome.tv): interlocutor's IP location, autoskip of the specified gender, blacklist, hotkeys, PiP, etc.

desc.message: This is a browser extension that extends the functionality of Chatruletka (aka ome.tv).

screen_remote.message: Make a screenshot from the interlocutor's camera

screen_local.message: Make a screenshot from your camera

main.message:
Important:
This extension is a hobby project and is not affiliated with the 'videochat platform' in any way.

Use it at your own risk.

apiStatus0.message:
IP geolocation API doesn't work at all.
You should read this, it might help.

github.message: More useful information: github.

hotkeys.message:
left arrow - skip
shift+left arrow - skip+ban
up arrow - stop
down arrow - report
left arrow - cancel report
right arrow - send report

custom: 'chrome://extensions/shortcuts'

avoidBanLinkText.message: I was banned. What should I do now?

avoidBanSwalInnerHTML.message:
There was an instruction for bypassing the ban, but due to the fact that the number of users grew very quickly, it was hidden behind the paywall, and now it has been completely removed.

Now here is just a list of what not to do if you don't want to get banned:
1. Don't show the middle finger to Chatruletka interlocutors, especially if they express that they want you to show it.
2. Do not write anything in the chat, especially insults or links.
3. Make sure that your face is visible and the picture is clear, otherwise you may get banned for an incorrect image.
4. Don't show your genitals to the camera.

That's all. Now that you have received a ban, you will have to deal with it yourself: either pay, or wait, or find a way around it yourself.

tooltipWatermark.message: hides the watermark in the upper left corner of the interlocutor's camera

tooltipBanner.message: hides the banner with the current instance logo, current overall online, and mobile applications

tooltipFour.message: automatically skip interlocutors that are taking more than 4 seconds to connect to

tooltipForcedRecognition.message: continues to determine the gender of the interlocutor even if the gender skipping is disabled

tooltipSkipMales.message: tries to determine the gender of the interlocutor and skips if faceapi is 90 percent sure that the gender of the interlocutor is male

tooltipSkipFemales.message: tries to determine the gender of the interlocutor and skips if faceapi is 90 percent sure that the gender of the interlocutor is female

tooltipMirror1.message: replaces your camera with a canvas that duplicates the image from the interlocutor's camera

tooltipMirror2.message: replaces your camera with a canvas that duplicates the image from the interlocutor's camera

tooltipPrikol.message: Replaces your camera with 'resources/prikol.mp4'. Useful only when using the extension in developer mode

tooltipAutoskip.message: automatically adds the interlocutor's IP to the blacklist, if he/she was automatically skipped by gender

tooltipDonotbanmobile.message: Prohibits adding mobile IP addresses to the blacklist. They are temporary and can be used by many users. Please disable if IP API is not working.

tooltipSkipSound.message: plays sound when added to the blacklist and when the banned interlocutor skips

tooltipEnableHotkeys.message: Enable cool arrows hotkeys. This does not affect the extension hotkeys that are configured in the browser settings.

warningWS.message: Use this only if you understand what you are doing.

warningCameraHijack.message: You can get banned in the chat for abusing these functions.

tooltipEnableWS.message: Interferes with the protocol of communication with the Chatruletka server, which allows you to use the functions described below. Bans are possible due to possible countermeasures/backend changes.

tooltipSkipSoundWS.message: plays sound when your interlocutor clicks 'Next'

tooltipSkipWrongCountry.message: instant skip if you are looking for someone from X country but service found you someone from Y country

tooltipReplacePreview.message: replaces the preview that the interlocutor sees while the connection is being established

tooltipDeletePreview.message: deletes the preview that the interlocutor sees while the connection is being established

tooltipReplaceReportPic.message: Replaces the image that the service uses to check you for violations. Avoiding accidental bans only. If lot of reports are sent to you, you will be banned anyway.

tooltipSentry.message: allows the extension to collect information about its errors and send them to sentry.io

reloadRequired.message: PAGE RELOAD IS REQUIRED BECAUSE YOU HAVE CHANGED SOME IMPORTANT SETTINGS

tooltipStreamerMode.message: Enables a special set of functions for streamers. If you disable it, everything below will not work.

tooltipStreamerHotkeys.message: enable a special set of hotkeys for streamers

streamerHotkeysText.message: <dd style='margin-inline-start: 40px!important;'>right arrow - blur</dd><dd style='margin-inline-start: 40px!important;'>m - mute remote video</dd><dd style='margin-inline-start: 40px!important;'>shift+right arrow - disable nsfwjs for session</dd>

tooltipStreamerPip.message: Allows you to open the interlocutor's camera in Picture-in-Picture mode. It can be used to monitor the interlocutor's camera while it is blurred. PiP is a separate window that does not affect the captured browser window (OBS).

tooltipBlurOnStart.message: every new conversation will start blurred

tooltipBlurPreviews.message: blur the preview in case your interlocutor uses a custom client that sends NSFW previews

tooltipPreviewBlurStrength.message: value for the preview blur filter

tooltipBlurCoverLocal.message: enable this if you also want to blur/cover your local video (mirror)

tooltipCoverOverBlur.message: enable this if you want cover instead of blur

tooltipCoverOverPreview.message: enable this if you want to activate cover when found (preview)

tooltipCoverOverNoise.message: enable this if you want to activate cover when searching

tooltipCoverOverStop.message: enable this if you want to activate cover when stopped

promptCoverSrc.message: Enter a direct link to the picture/gif (4:3) for use as the cover.

tooltipNsfwjsAlfa.message: Enables nsfwjs integration. It checks the image from the interlocutor's camera every N ms for the presence of NSFW, calculates points if the image is suspicious. If enough points have been scored in the last N checks, it blurs the interlocutor for N seconds. Use with caution.

tooltipLetUnblurInitial.message: If you turn this on and turn on 'startup blur', then nsfwjs will be able to remove the first initial blur. If you disable it you will have to unlock it manually.

tooltipLetUnblurAuto.message: if you enable this, and nsfwjs blurs something, it will unblur it after N seconds if nsfw is no longer displayed on screen

tooltipBlurDuration.message: how long to keep the blur (in sec) after the system finds the image is acceptable?

tooltipPredicationsArraySize.message: how many nsfw checks to count?

tooltipScoreToBlur.message: how many points do nsfwjs need to score to blur?

tooltipPornWeight.message: how many points to add, if image is considered 'porn'?

tooltipSexyWeight.message: how many points to add, if image is considered 'sexy'?

tooltipDoNotReflect.message: turn it on if you are uncomfortable seeing yourself reflected

doNotCover.message: do not crop the interlocutor's camera:

tooltipDoNotCover.message: enable this if you are uncomfortable looking at a cropped picture from mobile devices and want to see your interlocutor, and not the edge of his head

tooltipHideCamera.message: enable it to hide your camera to make the conversation more natural

tooltipEnableRisky.message: gives access to dangerous functions whose careless use can lead to a ban

tooltipApiLocalisation.message: Enable this so that the locations are displayed in the browser language. Available languages: Russian, German, Spanish, Portuguese, French, Japanese, Chinese.

tooltipHideMobile.message: Turn this on so that the city and region will be hidden if the interlocutor has mobile internet. Almost always these data are not correct.

tooltipShowMoreInfo.message: Enable this to display additional information about the IP address. Mobile - mobile (cellular) connection. Hosting -  proxy, VPN or Tor exit address. Hosting - hosting, colocated or data center.

tooltipShowISP.message: Enable this to show ISP (Internet Service Provider) data if available.

tooltipTargetSkipMobile.message: Mobile network is known for inaccurate geolocation. Should extension skip mobile network users when you are targeting for a specific place?

tooltipTargetCity.message: if interlocutor's city is not in provided list (City1, City2, City3) => skip.

promptTargetCity.message: enter city/list of cities you want to find

tooltipTargetRegion.message: if interlocutor's region is not in provided list (Region1, Region2, Region3) => skip.

promptTargetRegion.message: enter region/list of regions you want to find

tooltipTargetSound.message: plays a sound when the target city/region is found

tooltipTorrentsEnable.message: displays a button to search for torrents that your interlocutor probably downloaded (only for those IPs that are not recognized as mobile/tor/proxy)

tooltipTorrentsInfo.message: shows a modal explaining what the 'iknowwhatyoudownload' button means (it reappears after page reloads)

tooltipExpand.message: expands the height of the 'Settings' tab to make it easier to customize

swalInfoTitle2.message: This site is not what i expected...

swalInfoTitle5.message: A little bit about the extension

swalInfoText1.message:
You have just installed the 'Chatruletka (ome.tv) Extension'!

Now you have access to such functionality as the interlocutor's IP geolocation, Picture-in-Picture mode, filtering by city and gender, streamer mode, hot keys and 40+ more functions!

The purpose of the extension is to provide Chatruletka users with more features, while not harming the platform itself.

swalInfoText2.message:
If you are wondering this question, it is possible that you have used Chatruletka on another site with a slightly different interface.

This video chat network is known by many names: ome.tv, Chatruletka, minichat and others.

This extension only works on the website videochatru.com and ome.tv because it's easier than maintaining compatibility on all 40+ sites.

Although the sites look different, they use the same script: which means there is no difference where you connect from!

swalInfoText3.message:
This extension is a hobby project and is not affiliated with Chatruletka.
Use it at your own risk!

This is a free (MIT) open source extension that is available on github.

swalInfoText4.message:
For geolocation we use the service ip-api.com

This service is able to determine whether the interlocutor uses the mobile Internet.
If the interlocutor has mobile Internet, most likely the city is defined incorrectly, so it is hidden by default, only the time zone is displayed (you can change it in the settings).

In general, the location is determined with accuracy to the city/agglomeration.
The 'Map' tab shows the approximate radius where the interlocutor can be.

swalInfoText5.message:
The extension has so many functions that no one would read their full description.

You should look into the 'Settings' section and see for yourself.
If you hover the cursor over the name of the setting, a detailed description of the function will be displayed!

The extension does not collect any of your data, but it uses the service sentry to collect its runtime errors.
You can turn off error collection in the 'Settings' tab.

swalInfoText6.message: The project has a Discord server, where the update notifications come and where you can discuss the extension with other users.

YKWYDHtml.message:
iknowwhatyoudownload is a service that collects data from BitTorrent networks and associates pirate IP addresses with torrent distributions, earning money by working with copyright holders, advertisers and the police.

Simply put, you can find out what your interlocutor could have downloaded from torrents recently.

This is a great opportunity to discuss with the interlocutor his tastes in games, music, cinema and pornography!

You should not take this information as one hundred percent (one IP address could be used by several people + the service does not cover all pirate resources), but since the button is not displayed for mobile networks / known VPNs, the chances of success are very high!

Pay attention to the number of torrents: if there are 3-10, then it can be a real person, if there are 30+ of them, probably too many people used the IP address.

If you are a streamer, keep in mind that on the page that opens, the IP addresses of the interlocutor and YOURS ALSO will be displayed!
Make sure that you are using VPN / OBS is configured to capture exactly the Chatruletka window.

After clicking an 'OK' button, a window separate from Chatruletka will open, and if you click the button again, the old service tabs in this window will close.
You can display that new window on a second monitor/half screen.

minimalismExplainMobile.message: — IP address belongs to the mobile operator (the city may not be accurate).

minimalismExplainHosting.message: — IP address belongs to the data center.

switchModeTitle.message: You have just installed Chatruletka (ome.tv) Extension!

switchModeText.message:
Chatruletka Extension supports videochatru.com and ome.tv.

Please choose the mod that suits you best.

dangerWarningHtmlContent.message:
You have 'Danger Zone' enabled in your settings.

These are special features that can replace your camera with the interlocutors's camera or interfere with your connection to the Chatruletka server.

You can get banned from the chat for abusing certain features.

If you don't understand what they are doing or you think something is broken, turn off the 'danger zone', I warned you.

updateNeedReloadText.message:
Your browser has reloaded the extension, most likely it has downloaded a new version of it!
Please reload the page to restore the work.
